trans-unit.target: He stood on the old minbar of al-Azhar

trans-unit.source: ٍاَلْمَسْجِدُ يَفِيْضُ الْخَلْقَ مِنْ كُلِّ لَوْنٍ وَصِنْف
trans-unit.target: The mosque overflowing with people of every color and kind
trans-unit.note: Note the apparent shift in tense from perfect in segment one, to imperfect in this segment, and back to perfect in the next segment. But that's a misconstrual; the forms of the Arabic verb do not always encode tense. In particular, the so-called imperfect is basically equivalent to the (so-called) participle, so it should often be taken (as in this segment) as an adjective rather than a verb. Not "the mosque overflows/is overflowing with ..." but something closer to "the mosque overflowing with ..." Compare e.g. "He passed by a mosque full of people." The adjectival quality is effectively tenseless, or more precisely, its temporal sense is parasitic on the tense of the main verb. Note that if the author had introduced the connective وَ, as one would usually expect, the sense would be slightly different, something closer to "as the mosque overflowed..." or "while the mosque was overflowing with ...". But al-Ghitani routinely omits this so-called circumstantial waw, presumably for specific rhetorical purposes.
Normally َفَاض is intransitive, so we would expect ِالْمَسْجِدُ يَفِيْضُ بِالْخَلْق. Is this a typo, or a colloquial use of َفَاض as a transitive verb?

trans-unit.source: ْبَدَا وَكَأَنَّ كُلُّ قُوَّةٍ سَتَعْجِزُ عَنْ إِسْكَاتِهِم
قِيْلَ فِيْمَا بَعْدُ أَنَّهُ أُوْتِيَ مِقْدَرَةً عَلَى جَعْلِ الْخَلْقِ يَصْمُتُوْن
أَوَّلًا أَنَّهُ لَمْ يَكُنْ يَقْبَلُ الْحَسَبَةَ أَبَدًا
ِلَوْ لَا إِطْلَاعِهِ الْأُمَرَاءَ عَلَى مَا تَرْتَضِيْهِ رُوْحُهُ لِرَاحَةِ الْعِبَاد
trans-unit.note: الرَّاحَة BH: comfort, ease; ارْتَضَى to be satisfied, be content. Note the wordplay: رُوْح - رَاحَة, both from the root روح. A strict translation might run something like ``what his spirit finds acceptable for the comfort of the people.''

trans-unit.source: وَلَوْ لَا الشَْيْخُ الْعَارِفُ بِالْأُصُوْلِ وَالْفُرُوْعِ الزَّاهِدُ النَّاسِكُ وَلِيُّ اللّٰهِ أَبُو السُّعُوْدِ لَمَا قَبِلَ أَبَدًا
عَادَتْ يَدُهُ تَهْتَزُّ بِتُؤَدَةٍ فاستكان العامة وأصغوا)
trans-unit.note: تُؤَدَة root: وأد (Fusha); Wehr: على تُؤَدَةٍ deliberately, unhurriedly; Lane: leisurely or moderate manner of proceeding, calmly, etc. Syn: تَأَنٍّ وتَمَهُّل ورَزانَة وسَكِيّنَة

trans-unit.source: كَيْفَ يِلْقَى رَبَّهُ إِذَا ظَلِمَ مَخْلُوْقٌ مِنْ قِبَل أَحَدِ نُوَّابِهِ وَهُوَ لَا يَدْرِي؟
هٰذَا مَالَا يُطِيْقُهُ وَلَا يُمْكِنُهُ سَمَاعُهُ قَطُّ،
مِنْ هُنَا لَوْ وَقَعَ ظُلْمٌ عَلَى إِنْسَانٍ،

trans-unit.note: الْوَجْهَيْن the two regions of Egypt, الْوَحْهُ الْقِبْلِي (the southern face/direction) Upper Egypt, الْوَجْهُ الْبَحْرِي (the maritime face/direction) Lower Egypt

trans-unit.source: فَقَدْ أُضَيْفَتْ إِلَيْهِ الْيَوْمَ فَقَطْ نِظَارَةُ حَسَبَةِ الْجِيْزَةِ،
سَيَدُوْرُ ظَاهِرًا أَحْيَانًا وَمُتَخَفِّيًا حِيْنًا آخَرَ،
فَمَفْتُوْحٌ أَطْرَافَ اللَّيْلِ وَآنَاءَ النَّهَارِ لِكُلِّ ذِي حَاجَةٍ،
trans-unit.target: Well, open the extremities of the night and the times of the day to everyone in need
trans-unit.note: آنَاء, plural of أَنًى Wehr: (span of) time, period

trans-unit.target: No barrier between him and the people
The small and the great
In their various ranks

trans-unit.source: لَوْ ظُلِمَ أَحَدٌ مِنَ الْبَشَرِ فَلِيُقْتَصَّ مِنْهُ عَلَى مَرْأًى مِنَ الْجَمِيْعِ
trans-unit.target: If any human oppresses, let him be chastised in view of everybody
Fourth, and this is serious,

trans-unit.source: فِي كُلِّ حَارَةٍ، وَدَرْبٍ وَقَرِيَةٍ، وَبَلْدَةٍ وَأَقْطَاعٍ،
trans-unit.target: In every alley, and lane and village, and town and fief
trans-unit.note: BH: حارة narrow lane, alley (traditionally constituting a small neighborhood); Lane puts this under root حور, but the Lisaan puts it under حير and says الْحَارَة كُلُّ مَحَلَّةٍ دَنَتْ مَنَازِلُهُم فَهُم أَهْلُ حَارَةٍ ``every locale wherein the abodes of its people are close, they are called `the folk of the Hara'.''

trans-unit.source: سَتَكُوْنُ لَهُ عُيُوْنٌ يَرْصُدُوْنَ وَيَتَعَسَّسُوْنَ الْمَظَالِمَ أَيْنَمَا تَقَعُ،
trans-unit.target: He will have eyes observing and making the rounds at night surveilling the iniquities wherever they be
Informing him of them
After he left al-Azhar

trans-unit.source: شَقَّ طَرِيْقَهُ رَاكِبًا بَغْلَةً عَالِيَةً بِسَرْجٍ مُتَوَاضِعَ،
trans-unit.target: He made his way riding a high mule with a humble saddle
And an ordinary saddle-cloth
This excited (or aroused) the satisfaction of the people
They said, look how (it is with) justice and wisdom

trans-unit.source: اِسْتَمَرَّ مَوْكِبُهُ حَتَّى وَصَلَ سُوْقَ الشَّرَابْشِيِيْنَ،
trans-unit.target: His procession continued until it arrived at the Sharabshiyin market
trans-unit.note: شرارشيين؟ BH: شَربُوش (Persian) hood for protecting the lit tobacco in a water-pipe

trans-unit.source: قَابَلَتْهُ الْمُغَنِّيَاتُ بِالرَّقْصِ وَدَقِّ الشَّبَّابَةِ وَالدُّفُوْفِ،
trans-unit.target: Singers met it with dancing and the pulsing of reed flutes and tambourines
Ullulations burst out from the apertures (windows) of the houses

trans-unit.source: بَيْنَ يَدَيْهِ مَشَى ثَلاثَةٌ مِن نُّوَّابِهِ الْجُدُدِ الَّذِيْنَ لَمْ يَطَّلِعْ عَلَى وُجُوْهِهِم إِنْسَانٌ
trans-unit.target: Before him walked three of his new deputies whose faces nobody has seen
(Their origins are under investigation)
One of them bore a sword
Another carried a scale and weights

trans-unit.source: وَالثَّالِثُ يُلَوِّحُ بِمَصْحَفٍ كَبِيْرٍ يَلْثَمُهُ بَيْنَ الْحِيْنِ وَالْحِيْنِ،
trans-unit.target: And the third brandished a large Quran, kissing it from time to time

trans-unit.source: خَلْفَ الْمَوْكَبِ مَشَى عَبْدُ الْعَظِيْمِ الصَّيْرَفِي،
trans-unit.target: Behind the procession walked an And al-Azeem al-Sayrafi

trans-unit.source: أَمَّا الزَّيْنِي فَرَاحَ يَهِزُّ رَأْسَهُ هَزًّا خَفَيْفًا عَلَى وَجْهِهِ خُشُوْعٌ وَتَقْوَى
trans-unit.target: As for Zayni, he was shaking his head lightly, on his face humility and piety

trans-unit.source: لَفتَه أُوْلَى : أَجْمَعَ رِجَالُنَا عَلَى وُجُوْدِ طَالِبٍ أَزْهَرِيٍّ،
trans-unit.target: First remark: our men agree on the presence of an Azhar student

trans-unit.source: بَقِيَ طِوَالَ الرَّكْبِ عَلَى مَقْرِبَةٍ مِنَ الزَّيْنِي بَرَكَات،
trans-unit.target: He remained throughout the journey near Zayni Barakat
He appeared eager

trans-unit.source: بِالْكَشْفِ عَنْهُ، اتَّضَحَ أَنَّهُ هُوَ الَّذِي صَحَبَهُ مِنْ بَيْتِهِ إِلَى زَاوِيَةِ الشَّيْخِ أَبُو السُّعُوْدِ
trans-unit.target: Upon investigation him, it became clear that it was he that accompanied him from his house to the little mosque of the shaykh Abu al-Suud
trans-unit.note: زاوِيَة BH: small mosque without a minaret.

trans-unit.target: In Kom al-Jarih
His name is Said al-Juhaini

trans-unit.source: لَفْتَه ثَانِيَةٌ : عِنْدَ اقْتِرُاْبِ الْمَوْكَبِ مَنْ جَامِعِ الْحَاكِمِ،
trans-unit.target: Second remark: when the procession approached the Mosque of al-Hakim
Nearly passing by Bab al-Futuh

trans-unit.source: حَيْثُ يُمْكِنُ لِعَيْنَيْ الْعَابِرِ رُؤْيَةَ أَسْوَارِ سِجْنِ الْمَقْشَرَه،
trans-unit.target: Where the eyes of a passer-by can see the walls of the Maqshara prison
And its upper entrance

trans-unit.source: ظَهَرَتِ امْرَأَةٌ سَمِيْنَةٌ، مُتَقَدِّمَةٌ فِي الْعُمْرِ، تَرْتَدِي السَّوَادَ، تَتَّشِحُ بِطَرْحَةٍ قَدِيْمَةٍ،
trans-unit.target: A fat woman appeared, advanced in years, wearing black, draped in an old headscarf
She forced a way for herself
until she stood before the mule of Zayni
She shouted vehemently
so drew the attention of the people

trans-unit.source: طِلِعَ عَلَيْهَا طُلُوْعٌ لا يَهْتِفُ إِلَّا بِكَلِمَةٍ وَاحِدَةٍ
trans-unit.target: Upon her appeared a fit that yelled but a single thing
You vile bastard!
trans-unit.note: BH: cunning; Wehr: vile, wicked, filthy, etc Farouk: you bastard, you son of a bitch

trans-unit.target: And when the rabble notice they attacked her
She vanished into thin air
trans-unit.note: BH: crystal of coarse salt; فص مَلح وداب he vanished into thin air

trans-unit.target: She is being investigated
And her facts are being investigated
Who is she and where is she from?
Third remark

trans-unit.source: أَطْلَقْنَا أَحَدَ الْبَصَّاصِيْنَ الْمَهَرَةَ في أَثَرِ الزَّيْنِي لِرَسْمِ صُوْرَةً دَقِيْقَةً وَافِيَةً لِمَلَامِحِهِ،
trans-unit.target: We send one of our skilled spies after Zayni to draw a detailed and complete picture of his characteristics

trans-unit.source: سَنَنْقُلُهَا إِلَيْكُمْ فَوْرَ إِتْمَامِهَا لِاطِّلَاعِكُمْ عَلَيْهَا،
trans-unit.target: We shall transfer it to you as soon as it is finished, for your perusal
And to make the necessary examination
